# Introduction

This report analyzes the characteristics of spam emails using a Generalized Linear Model (GLM).

# Exploratory Data Analysis

```{r}
library(tidyverse)    
library(moderndive)   
library(gapminder)    
library(stats)        
library(jtools)       
library(sjPlot)       
```

```{r}
spam_data<-read.csv("C:/Users/24981/Documents/temp/DAS-Group-24/dataset24.csv")


spam_data <- spam_data %>%
  mutate(yesno = factor(yesno, levels = c("n", "y")))

glimpse(spam_data)

spam_data %>%
  summarise_all(~ sum(is.na(.)))

ggplot(spam_data, aes(x = yesno, y = crl.tot, fill = yesno)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  labs(title = "Distribution of Capital Run Length by Email Type",
       x = "Email Type", y = "Total Capital Run Length") +
  theme(legend.position = "none") +
  coord_cartesian(ylim = c(0, quantile(spam_data$crl.tot, 0.95)))

ggplot(spam_data, aes(x = yesno, y = dollar, fill = yesno)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  labs(title = "Dollar Sign Frequency by Email Type",
       x = "Email Type", y = "Dollar Sign Frequency") +
  theme(legend.position = "none") +
  coord_cartesian(ylim = c(0, quantile(spam_data$dollar, 0.95)))

ggplot(spam_data, aes(x = yesno, y = bang, fill = yesno)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  labs(title = "Exclamation Mark Frequency by Email Type",
       x = "Email Type", y = "Exclamation Mark Frequency") +
  theme(legend.position = "none")+
  coord_cartesian(ylim = c(0, quantile(spam_data$bang, 0.95)))

ggplot(spam_data, aes(x = yesno, y = money, fill = yesno)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  labs(title = "The Term 'Money' Frequency by Email Type",
       x = "Email Type", y = "Occurrences of ‘money’") +
  theme(legend.position = "none")+
  coord_cartesian(ylim = c(0, quantile(spam_data$money, 0.95)))

ggplot(spam_data, aes(x = yesno, y = n000, fill = yesno)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  labs(title = "The Term '000' Frequency by Email Type",
       x = "Email Type", y = "Occurrences of ‘000’") +
  theme(legend.position = "none")

ggplot(spam_data, aes(x = yesno, y = make, fill = yesno)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  labs(title = "The Term 'make' Frequency by Email Type",
       x = "Email Type", y = "Occurrences of ‘make’") +
  theme(legend.position = "none")+
  coord_cartesian(ylim = c(0, quantile(spam_data$make, 0.95)))

glm_model <- glm(yesno ~ crl.tot + dollar + bang + money + n000 + make, 
                 data = spam_data, family = binomial)

summary(glm_model)

summ(glm_model, confint = TRUE, digits = 3)

plot_model(glm_model, show.values = TRUE, transform = NULL,
           title = "Log-Odds of Spam Email Features", show.p = TRUE)

plot_model(glm_model, show.values = TRUE, transform = "exp",
           title = "Odds of Spam Email Features", show.p = TRUE)

model_coefs <- coef(glm_model)

logit_pred <- model_coefs["(Intercept)"] + model_coefs["crl.tot"] * 100

spam_prob <- plogis(logit_pred)
spam_prob

spam_data <- spam_data %>%
  mutate(probs.spam = predict(glm_model, type = "response"))

plot_model(glm_model, type = "pred", terms = "crl.tot",
           title = "Predicted Probability of Spam Email",
           axis.title = c("Total Capital Run Length", "Probability of Spam Email"))
```
